poemContent: C666H1334 Hydrocarbon of DEATH,a long, viscous gooey oozy liquid, smaller than ahair on your head.C333H666 alkene of life, saviour ofhope, restorer of good, holier than thou,So next time you ride down the bitumen road,look out for the Hydrocarbon of Death, as ithath foretold, an impending doom doth awaits,so stop that car, slam on the breaks,and pray, that the hydrocarbon of lifewill appear, a fate avoided, oh so near.Yet if it doesn't, you have no options left,you may have escaped the car crash,but not the sniper aimed at your head.
